6.note: High activity normal at age 6. Look for extreme impairment across ALL settings.

9.note: Hyperactivity should be decreasing. Persistent extreme motor restlessness is concerning.

12.note: Physical hyperactivity atypical at age 12. Inattention and executive dysfunction more prominent.

15.note: ADHD presents as executive dysfunction, time management issues, procrastination.

18.note: ADHD manifests as chronic disorganization, inability to manage adult responsibilities.
